intro: Notanthera buxifolius, commonly known as the boxleaf notanthera, is a species of flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage that resembles the appearance of boxwood, hence its common name. Its small, clustered flowers are typically pink or red, and they bloom in late spring to early summer. Notanthera buxifolius is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its attractive appearance and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
